p.s: The given poem Sonnet 138 fromShakespeare deals with a relationship between a woman and an otheranother person.
The first quatrain the narrator voices that he would believe the other person.
When she says, that she loves him, though he knows that it is not true.
The lying one is on the opinion that her partner is unexperienced and young.
In the following a contradiction comes up in the first two sentences of the second quatrain.
It says again that the female person thinks that the other other is young but the lyrical eye denies this thesis by saying tht his best days were a long time ago.
Besides the persona of the poem highlights his opinion that the other person is a liar by repeating his thesis with other words.
The third and last quatrain starts with a rhetorical question, where the narrator asks, why the women does not say the truth.
Therefore he questions, why shes does not mention that he is old and not young.
After this questions the speaker says that being trustworthy is a habit of herself.
The sonnet ends with a couplet, where headunits that both of them lie with the other person and whether they do mistakes because of this, they get difficulties.
The couplet is like the statement of this sonnet.
